item.title: 随着人工智能技术的成熟，投资者或将在 2026 年寻找价值投资机会
item.description: 多位分析师表示，随着人们对人工智能泡沫的担忧与日俱增，促使交易商将目光投向估值较高的科技股之外，全球投资者今年将积极在金融市场价值被低估的领域寻找机会。【原文：Global investors will actively seek opportunities this year in undervalued pockets of financial markets as growing concerns over an AI bubble push traders to look beyond highly valued technology stocks, according to several analysts.】

item.title: 自动驾驶技术和人工智能在 CES 上大放异彩，汽车制造商缩减电动汽车计划
item.description: 自动驾驶技术预计将在本周拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 展会上占据主导地位，因为投资者押注人工智能将为这个饱受进展缓慢、成本高昂、安全事故和监管审查困扰的行业注入活力。【原文：Autonomous driving technology is expected to dominate the CES trade show in Las Vegas this week as investors bet that artificial intelligence will invigorate an industry beset by slow progress, high costs, safety incidents and regulatory scrutiny.】

item.title: 特朗普对委内瑞拉石油采取行动后，雪佛龙和美国炼油商股价大涨
item.description: 美国石油公司的股票在周一盘前交易中上涨，因为投资者押注唐纳德-特朗普总统针对委内瑞拉领导层的举动将使美国公司有更多机会获得世界上最大的石油储备。【原文：U.S. oil companies' shares rose in premarket trading on Monday as investors bet that President Donald Trump's move against Venezuela's leadership would allow American firms greater access to the world's largest oil reserves.】

item.title: 科迪亚克人工智能公司与博世合作，扩大自动驾驶卡车的硬件规模
item.description: 科迪亚克人工智能公司（Kodiak AI）周一表示，该公司已与博世合作，加强自动驾驶卡车硬件和传感器的制造，因为这家自动驾驶卡车公司希望从试点部署转向大规模商业推广。【原文：Kodiak AI said on Monday it has partnered with Bosch to ramp up manufacturing of autonomous trucking hardware and sensors, as the self-driving truck company looks to move from pilot deployments toward large-scale commercial rollout.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Nexperia 纠纷公开听证会定于 1 月 14 日举行
item.description: 周一，两位熟悉法律诉讼程序的消息人士告诉路透社，荷兰法院将于 1 月 14 日举行听证会，听取有关是否应对 Nexperia 公司涉嫌管理不善展开正式调查的争论。【原文：A Dutch court will hold a hearing on January 14 to hear arguments as to whether it should open a formal investigation into alleged mismanagement at Nexperia, two sources familiar with the legal proceedings told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国敦促银行披露与委内瑞拉的贷款关系
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周一援引知情人士的话报道称，在美国逮捕委内瑞拉总统后，中国最高金融监管机构要求其政策性银行和其他主要贷款机构报告其对委内瑞拉的贷款风险敞口。【原文：China's top financial regulator asked its policy banks and other major lenders to report their lending exposure to Venezuela after the U.S. capture of the Venezuelan president, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚博思格钢铁公司称 12 月收到 88 亿美元收购要约
item.description: 澳大利亚博思格钢铁公司（BlueScope Steel）周一表示，该公司在 12 月份收到了一个由澳大利亚和美国公司组成的财团提出的指示性收购要约，对这家钢铁制造商的估值为 131.5 亿澳元（87.8 亿美元）。【原文：Australia's BlueScope Steel on Monday said it received an indicative takeover offer in December from a consortium of Australian and U.S. companies, valuing the steelmaker at A$13.15 billion ($8.78 billion).】

item.title: 印度尼西亚前部长马卡里姆因采购谷歌笔记本电脑面临贪污指控
item.description: 印尼检察官周一对前教育部长、初创公司 Gojek 联合创始人纳迪姆-马卡里姆（Nadiem Makarim）提出腐败指控，称他在笔记本电脑大流行期间采购不当，导致国家损失 1.2564 亿美元。【原文：Indonesian prosecutors on Monday filed corruption charges against former education minister and the co-founder of startup Gojek, Nadiem Makarim, over alleged improper laptop procurement during the pandemic that led to $125.64 million in state losses.】

item.title: 诺和诺德将向美国自费患者出售韦格韦药片，起价为每月 149 美元
item.description: 丹麦诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）周一表示，从1月5日起，该公司将以每月149美元的价格向美国自费患者提供1.5毫克和4毫克的Wegovy减肥药。【原文：Denmark's Novo Nordisk will offer its 1.5 and 4 milligram Wegovy weightloss pills at $149 per month to self-paying patients in the United States from January 5, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 富士康第四季度收入增长 22%，创人工智能需求历史新高
item.description: 受人工智能产品强劲需求的推动，全球最大的合约电子制造商台湾富士康周一公布了创纪录的第四季度收入报告。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn, the world's largest contract electronics maker, reported record fourth-quarter revenue on Monday, driven by strong demand for artificial intelligence products.】

item.title: 台湾检方对台积电商业机密案追加起诉
item.description: 台湾检方周一表示，已对涉嫌窃取芯片制造商台积电商业机密的东京电子台湾分公司及其他三名被告追加起诉。【原文：Taiwan prosecutors said on Monday it had filed additional indictments against the Taiwan unit of Tokyo Electron and three other defendants in a case involving the alleged theft of trade secrets from chipmaker TSMC.】

item.title: 摩根大通称，美国抓捕马杜罗可能使委内瑞拉和 PDVSA 的债券上涨多达 10 个点
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）的分析师估计，美国抓捕总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗（Nicolas Maduro）预计将引发委内瑞拉国际债务周一反弹最多10个点。【原文：The U.S. capture of President Nicolas Maduro is expected to set to trigger a rally of up to 10 points in Venezuela's international debt no Monday, analysts at JPMorgan estimated.】

item.title: 现代汽车 2026 年全球销量目标为 416 万辆
item.description: 韩国现代汽车公司（Hyundai Motor Co）周一表示，该公司今年的目标是销售416万辆汽车，此前2025年的销量为414万辆，略低于去年417万辆的销售目标。【原文：South Korea's Hyundai Motor Co said on Monday it aims to sell 4.16 million vehicles this year, after reporting 2025 sales of 4.14 million vehicles, slightly below last year's sales target of 4.17 million units.】

item.title: 特朗普的委内瑞拉赌局考验投资者的地缘政治风险偏好
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁在美洲采取进一步行动后，市场可能已经摆脱了美国抓捕委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗（Nicolas Maduro）的大胆举动，但一些投资者警告说，地缘政治风险可能被低估了。【原文：Markets may have shrugged off the audacious U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, but some investors warn that geopolitical risks are perhaps being underestimated after Donald Trump threatened further action in the Americas.】

item.title: 本田因芯片短缺延长在华工厂停工期
item.description: 本田汽车周一表示，由于半导体短缺，该公司将把在中国的三家汽车厂的停产时间延长两周，这凸显了日本第二大汽车制造商供应链持续紧张的问题。【原文：Honda Motor said on Monday it will extend a production halt at three car plants in China by two weeks due to a semiconductor shortage, highlighting persistent supply chain strains for Japan's second-biggest automaker.】

item.title: 美国汽车销量不惧监管不确定性，2025 年将增长 2
item.description: 据分析师估计，2025 年美国新车销量增长了约 2%，这对于一个 "黑天鹅 "事件已成为家常便饭的行业来说，是不畏异常混乱的一年。【原文：Sales of new cars in the United States rose about 2% in 2025, analysts estimate, defying a year of extraordinary disruption for an industry where "black swan" events have become routine.】

item.title: 投资者称，人工智能驱动的通胀是 2026 年最容易被忽视的风险
item.description: 2026 年伊始，全球股市在人工智能的欢呼声中高歌猛进，但可能忽略了一个可能破坏狂欢的最大威胁：部分由科技投资热潮推动的通胀飙升。【原文：Global stock markets, riding high on AI euphoria at the start of 2026 may be disregarding one of the biggest threats that could spoil the party: a surge in inflation driven partly by the tech investment boom.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国人工智能企业 MiniMax 在香港的首次公开募股定价有望达到区间最高价
item.description: 三位知情人士周一表示，中国人工智能初创企业MiniMax集团预计将以定价区间的最高价完成香港首次公开募股，此前交易账簿已多次超额认购。【原文：Chinese AI startup MiniMax Group is expected to settle its Hong Kong initial public offering at the top of its pricing range, after deal books have been oversubscribed multiple times, three people with knowledge of the situation said on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞标委内瑞拉动荡考验市场
item.description: 格雷戈尔-斯图尔特-亨特对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Gregor Stuart Hunter】

item.title: 特朗普警告将因购买俄罗斯石油对印度征收更高的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在空军一号上对记者说，如果新德里不满足华盛顿提出的限制购买俄罗斯石油的要求，美国可能会提高对印度的关税。【原文：The United States could raise tariffs on India if New Delhi doesn't meet Washington's demand to curb purchases of Russian oil, President Donald Trump told reporters aboard Air Force One.】

item.title: 报告称，2025 年中国对台湾基础设施的网络攻击平均每天达 260 万次
item.description: 台湾国家安全局说，有些演习与 "混合威胁 "军事演习同步进行，目的是瘫痪台湾岛。【原文：Some were synchronised with military drills in "hybrid threats" to paralyse the island, Taiwan's National Security Bureau said.】

item.title: 市场分析师对特朗普的委内瑞拉赌局作出反应
item.description: 在美国逮捕委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗之后，全球投资者正面临着地缘政治风险的新一轮飙升，尽管市场的初步反应相对平淡，石油波动剧烈，避险资金流动提振了黄金。【原文：Global investors are facing a fresh surge in geopolitical risk after the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, although initial market reaction has been relatively devoid of nerves with oil volatile and safe-haven flows lifting gold.】

item.title: 独家报道三星今年将把采用谷歌 "双子星 "技术的移动设备翻一番，达到 8 亿台
item.description: 三星联席首席执行官 T M Roh 告诉路透社，随着全球人工智能竞争的白热化，这将为谷歌带来超越竞争对手的优势。【原文：Samsung's co-CEO T M Roh told Reuters this would give Google an edge over rivals as the global race in artificial intelligence hots up.】

item.title: 日本央行总裁誓言继续提高利率
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周一表示，如果经济和物价发展符合其预测，央行将继续提高利率。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Monday the central bank will continue to raise interest rates if economic and price developments move in line with its forecasts.】

item.title: 私营企业采购经理人指数显示，中国 12 月服务业增速创 6 个月新低
item.description: 周一的一项私营部门调查显示，由于新业务增长放缓和国外需求下降，12 月份中国服务业活动的扩张速度为六个月来最慢。【原文：China's services activity expanded at its slowest pace in six months in December, as growth in new business softened and foreign demand declined, a private-sector survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 亚洲股市摆脱委内瑞拉影响攀升；石油市场波动剧烈
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市高开，油价波动，投资者对美国周末在委内瑞拉采取的军事行动持观望态度。【原文：Asian stocks opened higher and oil prices were choppy on Monday as investors looked past U.S. military action over the weekend in Venezuela.】

item.title: 日本制造业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示：需求下降放缓，日本工厂活动保持稳定
item.description: 一项私营部门调查显示，由于需求下降速度比上月放缓，日本制造业活动在 12 月份陷入停滞，结束了连续五个月的恶化。【原文：Japan's manufacturing activity stalled in December as demand declined at a slower pace from the previous month, a private-sector survey showed, ending a five-month streak of deterioration.】

item.title: 新西兰启动对医疗门户网站黑客攻击的审查
item.description: 新西兰政府周一表示，新西兰卫生部将调查一家私营网站发生网络安全漏洞的原因，该网站托管了新西兰约三分之一人口的医疗记录，以及需要采取哪些额外保护措施。【原文：New Zealand’s health ministry will look into the cause of a cybersecurity breach of a privately owned website, which hosts medical records for roughly a third of the country’s population and what extra protections are needed, the government said Monday.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉突袭令美元走强
item.description: 新年第一个完整交易周伊始，美元便一马当先，对欧元汇率升至三周半高点，对英镑汇率也有所上涨。【原文：The dollar started the first full trading week of the new year on the front foot, rising to a 3-1/2-week high versus the euro and gaining against sterling.】

item.title: 起亚目标 2026 年汽车销量达 335 万辆
item.description: 韩国汽车制造商起亚公司在周一提交的一份监管文件中表示，该公司的目标是在2026年销售335万辆汽车。【原文：South Korean automaker Kia Corp said in a regulatory filing on Monday it is targeting 3.35 million vehicle sales in 2026.】
